post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
In the years that I've posted here at Doom3World I've seen a lot of new modders starting with very little knowledge but a lot of enthusiasm on their projects. Some started out with big ideas (which is good, I did the same). The thing is though, that modding always takes a lot more work than anticipated, and it takes knowledge covering a myriad of expertises.

As an example, we were hoping to make Hexen:Edge of Chaos in the timespan of 1-2 years, we're in year 5 of development...

Those new modders that came with very little experience and tried to start big projects all failed, simply because it was way too hard. This is a big shame, because it means that perhaps very talented modders have dropped out simply because the work was too difficult and daunting.

Most of those modders that came and started out small, knowing nothing at first, but starting with simple things (change the color of a shirt, create a simple weaopn mod etc..) are still around and are now experienced modders.

I'm trying to say this as kindly as I can, because I don't want to drive away people, but you'll be put off of modding soon if you try for something hard (what you want is hard). So I want to give you this tip: Make a simple mod, or 5 then think again about making this kind of larger mod. Otherwise you might be put off modding forever, which would be a shame.
